audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a friendly greeting from a single female speaker. She welcomes the audience to her channel and announces that she will be analyzing the teaser trailer for "Wish," looking for Disney Easter eggs. Her tone is enthusiastic and conversational.

The audio clip begins with a spoken explanation of what is shown when the Disney 100 logo appears on screen, describing a kingdom with distinct architectural details. The speaker has an enthusiastic and informative tone, detailing colors, landmarks like a bell tower reminiscent of "The Hunchback of Notre Dame," and references to other Disney movies, such as seagulls ("The Little Mermaid"). The audio then transitions to a description of a lower shot of the kingdom with observations about a child flying a kite, possibly a reference to "Mary Poppins," along with background activities, such as a man juggling, a woman playing guitar, and a couple dancing, evoking a marketplace scene similar to "Aladdin." The speaker is female.

The clip begins with a single female speaker in an excited and analytical tone, discussing a scene with "Asha and her goat Valentino." She references Ariana DeBose and mentions "a heroine, rather than a princess." The speaker then describes Valentino blowing out a dandelion, linking it to a reference in Beauty and the Beast, and suggests Asha is "going on a mission" to see King Magnifico. The clip ends.

The clip begins with a single female speaker, describing a scene inside a castle with an illustration of the sun on the ground, which she associates with "Corona's crest in Tangled." She speaks in an excited, informative tone. She moves on to other circular symbols linked to Disney films, like the trident from "The Little Mermaid" and Maui's hook from "Moana." She mentions magical blue balls falling from the roof, which she believes contains the wishes of people. The speaker reflects on how these balls remind her of bubbles in Cinderella and the element symbols in Frozen 2 and the dragon gem in Raya and the Last Dragon.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker discussing "King Magnifico" who's "standing alone in this same room looking outside." She references "magical potions in a lab-like setting" and compares their usage to other Disney villains from films like "Alice in Wonderland," "Snow White," and "Hercules." The speaker claims that the villainous usage confirms "that the king is the bad guy." She continues, explaining that "King Magnifico then glares at the camera and gives an evil look as a green light appears in his eyes." The speaker then connects the green light to villains like "Maleficent," "Scar," and "Dr. Facilier" and compares the visual framing to that of "Lady Tremaine" and "Ursula." The speaker uses a descriptive, narrative tone throughout.

The audio clip features a single female speaker describing a movie trailer. Her tone is inquisitive and mildly critical as she recounts the trailer's plot of a magical king who grants wishes selectively, calling the king's actions "pretty evil." There are no other discernible sounds present in the clip.

The audio clip starts with one female speaker narrating, describing Asha and Valentino running away from a castle into a forest as King Magnifico does "an evil laugh." She points out the forest and wishes as Disney movie references, and then describes Asha on a tree with "a beam of light" and Valentino blocking their eyes.  She adds, Asha sees a star rushing past her, and leans against the "Wishing well from Snow White." Asha says "What was that?" and the female speaker continues to describe the scene and its visual similarities with other Disney classics, noting Star bringing pink flowers to life like the "talking flowers from Alice in Wonderland."  Next, the narrator explains Valentino is eating "Star's magic" that looks similar to "Pixie dust" and it is responsible for Valentino’s new "ability to talk."

A female speaker describes a scene where someone initially believes a wish didn't work but then realizes it was granted, expressing surprise that their voice is so low. The speaker then mentions Asha's main song, originally called "More for Us" but renamed "This Wish," and notes Benjamin Rice will be writing songs alongside Julia Michaels. Following this, the speaker transitions to Disney boasting about films like Frozen. The audio transitions to music, with a genre of Disney or Musical Theater. Finally, there are no discernible background sounds.

The audio clip starts with a female speaker mentioning popular Disney movies, the Lion King and Moana. She describes a scene from the trailer, noting Valentino's wonder at flying flowers in trees and drawing a parallel to "Gale moving around the leaves in Frozen 2." Moving on to another scene, she talks about Asha walking through the Grandmother Willow tree vines during her "I want song." Back in the trailer, Valentino is seen playing in the trees. The speaker then notes that Disney shows more of their famous titles. Continuing, the next shot is of King Magnifico, who is in front of an "adoring crowd," releasing crystals and stars. According to the speaker, the crowd loves the event, and there are thousands of people at this event. The audio clip ends with the speaker describing a "group of people" who are main characters.

The audio clip contains the speech of one speaker, a female, speaking in an enthusiastic and speculative tone about a group of young people that may represent the seven dwarves. The speaker lists off names that correspond to dwarves: "this one is sneezy", "happy", "bashful", "grumpy", "dopey", "doc", and "sleepy." Then the speaker refers to a discovery of the connection made on Twitter. The speaker transitions to talking about a picture, describing the colors of someone’s clothes as “purple with hints of yellow”, and another person wearing a “yellow and green outfit with a purple cape”, hypothesizing this could be the father or grandfather of the younger characters.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker's enthusiastic explanation that "Wish" is a century-in-the-making story, as Walt Disney Animation Studios has been making films for 100 years. We then hear that Asha appears to be singing while looking up at the stars through an archway, with Valentino standing behind her. The speaker believes this scene takes place in the castle. The speaker also points out that the green lights suggest that something is not right in the kingdom. The speaker then indicates Asha is surrounded by birds which is a staple in Disney fairy tales. They fly upwards at once and Asha stares at them as they travel into the sky. The speaker concludes that one bird hangs back to be with Valentino, and he seems delighted to have a new animal friend.

The audio clip opens with a woman speaking in a conversational tone about magical wishing balls and a king's hand in a shot, noting the presence of magical potions on tables. She transitions to discussing a shot of a bunny and colorful butterflies, referencing several Disney films. The woman continues, describing a scene of Asha riding a gray horse towards a palace and suggesting a parallel to Ariel's deadline in The Little Mermaid, still speaking in a conversational tone.

The audio clip begins with one female speaker, discussing a "tangled reference," mentioning friends and ropes, and comparing the scene to Flynn Rider in Tangled, suggesting the characters "could be attempting to free people's wishes." Her tone is enthusiastic and analytical. This transitions to discussion of "Star flying into the sky," resembling fireworks, and a regular occurrence at Disney theme parks. She describes the "King" on a white horse with gold, similar to Maximus. Concluding the analysis, she mentions looking up at the stars before a logo reveal with "sparkling crystals," followed by an alternative logo made of tiny stars and beams of light. The tone throughout remains consistent, suggesting a commentary or review format.

The audio clip begins with a speaker, presumably female, ending a video with a friendly and upbeat tone, saying "Anyway that is all for today, like this video if you liked it and please subscribe. It would mean so much to me. Bye now and have a magical day!".
